entry.title: Archiving SecuROM and ISO Tools
entry.content:
As many of you will happily know, SecuROM has been retired from development and general updates from Sony or SecuROM since Microsoft decided to completely drop support for it going into the Windows 10 era, due to concerns about the DRM being too intrusive, and potentially dangerous to users’ computers. The company behind SecuDisc, and also SecuROM themselves have spoken out heavily against this, but the service has now been retired. If you want to read more about the spat, you can check out the handy RockPaperShotgun article here

What this also means, however, is that many of the resources that are or were available on the SecuROM website that were extremely useful, such as the diagnostic error tool or the temporary file removal tool, are either already taken off the official SecuROM website, or will be in the future, as the only remains of the company as of 2018 is their support website, which itself is slowly dying and shutting itself down. So, in an effort to preserve a method of removing SecuROM and all it’s remaining files and registry keys, as well as the ways of circumventing the DRM when the checking servers eventually go offline, this site is now archiving related files and programs in The Index.

To detail what’s been added, the programs that are up today are:

  • ProtectionID 6.4
  • SecuROM Diagnostics
  • SecuROM Removal Tool

ProtectionID is a program which will detect what version of old or new SecuROM DRM is being used, and then report this to the user. It’s as simple as that, but very useful for debugging problems when reverse engineering or trying to activate software. SecuROM diagnostic tool is also very useful for this, as it gives the user solutions to detected SecuROM errors while the program is running, as well as dump reports. Finally, SecuROM removal tool will remove any dangling remains of the DRM from a computer that has ever installed a disc using it. This is extremely useful, as the service has been known to slow and chug systems.

You can find downloads for all of these tools in Cold Storage, as they’re all freeware/shareware tools.

Happy hunting,
C272

entry.title: The Index
entry.content:
Introduction

Welcome to “The Index”, a massive list that encompasses all files dredged up by the LostFileArchives team. It’s sorted in alphabetical order, and files can be downloaded from the links in the name. Select files may not be able to download directly from the website, and must be downloaded via. contact with one of the website administrators so they can copy out the archive. Have fun.

There are two types of storage on the website, cold storage and hot storage. Cold storage is the storage that’s permanently available and frozen on the site, and these are the ones that are always available to download on-demand. Hot storage files are the ones that are archived on completely separate offline hard drives, and must be requested via. contact with one of the site administrators, as the files need to be kept offline and safe in storage, or are simply not frequently required. As mentioned, please contact us through our “Contact” page in this instance, and we will be happy to help.

  • C272

ProtectionID 6

Overview

ProtectionID 6 is a tool that scans games using older DRM (2004-2011) and can detect what type of DRM is being used. The program can detect DLLs, DAT files, EXE files and supports CD Lock, Codelok, Laserlock, Safecast, Safedisc, SecuROM, Starforce, VOB Protect CD, CD-Checks and more.

Download

Download Archive Entry - ProtectionID 6.40

 

SecuROM Diagnostic Tool (by SecuROM)

Overview

This official tool will diagnose any SecuROM errors you may encounter when trying to run a legitimate SecuROM game, and encounter a failure. It will also instruct you on how to fix the errors, however the fixes are not definite, and the tool is known to fail on occasion.

Download

Download Archive Entry - SecuROM Removal Tool

 

SecuROM Removal Tool (by SecuROM)

Overview

This official tool will remove SecuROM leftover files after a SecuROM game is removed from a computer. This will NOT crack your game and is not designed to, and is only designed to remove leftover files. You use this tool at your own risk, as unfortunately, there have been known incidents of corruption.
